intro: Hieracium praecox subsp. incisoides, commonly known as the early hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lobed or toothed. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and forest edges.
